messageBody:
Hi Johannes,

Thanks for the note on Abbot :) In addition to being invokable from
scripts, the abbot framework is also usable directly from within
hand-coded test cases. The basic facilities provide a higher level of
abstraction than the basic java.awt.Robot (thus the derivation of the
name, A Better 'Bot). The abstraction level is something like this:

tester.actionClick(component);
tester.actionSelectCell(row, col);
tester.actionDrag(component, x, y);
tester.actionDrop(component, x, y);
tester.actionKeyString("A message typed");

All of these actions are translated into their basic OS-level events.
The abbot framework test suite uses these actions in run-of-the-mill
JUnit test cases to test its own recording and playback capabilities.

The script-level facilities lend themselves to system and functional
testing while the programmatic ones are more suited to fine-grained unit
testing.

T.
